architecture.title: AI-Native DevOps Framework
architecture.description: Zeus is designed to convert plain-language prompts into real, deployable blockchain infrastructure. It's not just a scripting tool—it’s an intelligent agent system for builders.

architecture.title: Modular Agent System
architecture.description: At its core, Zeus uses specialized agents for planning, validating, and deploying. These agents can be extended with adapters for multiple chains like Solana and EVM, each with a configurable 'persona' to define its behavior and risk model.

architecture.title: From Prompt to Infrastructure
architecture.description: User intent, like “deploy a burnable Solana token,” is passed to a built-in LLM planner. This generates structured JSON blueprints which are then rendered into Dockerfiles, deployment scripts, and even markdown documentation.

architecture.title: Local-First Philosophy
architecture.description: Your data and operations stay on your machine. Zeus runs 100% locally with no remote AI calls or cloud dependencies, and can even be used offline after the initial setup.

architecture.title: Wallet Risk Engine
architecture.description: Before a deployment goes live, Zeus can audit a wallet via RPC and score its risk based on past on-chain behavior. Includes built-in support for Solana transaction indexing and local SQLite caching.

architecture.title: zk-Audit Layer (Planned)
architecture.description: A forward-looking feature to attach zero-knowledge attestations to each deployment, providing cryptographic receipts for your infrastructure without revealing sensitive details.

roadmap.title: Multi-Chain Support
roadmap.description: Extend deployment capabilities beyond EVM to chains like Solana and Polkadot.

roadmap.title: Plugin Architecture
roadmap.description: Enable developers to build and share custom plugins to extend Zeus's core functionality.

roadmap.title: AI-Powered Audits
roadmap.description: Integrate automated smart contract auditing powered by advanced AI models.
